    Chiranjib Saha

    3GPP Standards Engineer at Qualcomm | PhD in Wireless Communication

    About me

    I received the B.E. degree (Hons.) in electronics and telecommunication engineering from Jadavpur University, India, in 2015. I completed my M.S and PhD (dual degree) at Virginia Tech, in Bradley Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering. I am presently a Senior Engineer at Qualcomm Technologies, working on standardization activities in 3GPP. I have held summer internship positions at Samsung Reseach America, Plano, TX, USA, Nokia Bell Labs, Naperville, IL, USA, and the National University of Singapore. I was a recipient of the Wireless Fellowship awarded by Wireless@VT, Virginia Tech, in 2015. ——

    Research Interests

    1. Physical (PHY) layer communication.
    2. Stochastic Geometry
    3. Signal Processing
    4. Machine Learning
